DOCNAME: CASE OF MARIA KACZMARCZYK v. POLAND
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant ’s father lodged an application with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) for distribution of the inheritance from his late wife . The applicant was a participant in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered that expert evidence be obtained .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL of the participants challenged the expert opinion .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted her own proposal to the court for distribution of inheritance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the expert submitted his new opinion .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the court proposed that the participants conclude a friendly settlement . CARDINAL of the participants accepted the court ’s proposal .

CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the court ordered that new expert evidence be obtained . It also ordered the participants to pay an advance to cover the costs of the preparation of an expert report ..

CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided that , as the participants had failed to comply with the order of CARDINAL DATE , the costs of the preparation of expert opinions would be temporarily covered by the court .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , PERSON , CARDINAL of the participants in the proceedings , unsuccessfully challenged the presiding judge CARDINAL times .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court appointed experts to prepare opinions on agriculture and forestry . The experts submitted their reports on DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) refused to deal with her cassation appeal .
